solution: Since the two angles together form a line, we have $(x + 26^\circ)+ (2x+10^\circ) = 180^\circ$.  Simplifying gives $3x + 36^\circ = 180^\circ$, so $3x = 144^\circ$ and $x = \boxed{48^\circ}$.
model_solution:
Since the sum of the angles along a straight line is 180°, we have the equation $$x+26^\circ+2x+10^\circ=180^\circ.$$
Combine like terms to get $3x+36^\circ=180^\circ.$
Subtract $36^\circ$ from both sides to get $3x=144^\circ.$
Divide both sides by 3 to get x = 48.
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x = 48.$
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x=48$.
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x = 48.$

Subtract $36^\circ$ from both sides to get $3x=144^\circ.$
Divide both sides by 3 to get x = 48.
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x = 48.$
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x=48$.
Divide both sides by 3 to get $x = 48.$
